title: Should riot put an option to report for "Boosted Account" or "Purchased Account"?
body: I am pretty sure you guys ran into someone who clearly are boosted or they bought their account online, should they add this option so I can report accordingly?

replies.body: Should be covered by “cheating” reports, right?

Public data does not in any way definitively say an account is boosted or purchased. The private data Riot has that can determine this is very trivial to automatically evaluate, and in fact players get their accounts locked for this quite frequently already. Just because you think someone is boosted does not mean they actually were.

I dunno, in many cases we can make very defensible judgments regarding the presence of boosting from an educated look over somebody's match history. Happens all the time when folks complain during a ban-wave on these boards.

Whether that can realistically happen in time for somebody to report them using the in-client function is less certain.
I dont think that's really proving it, we are just saying that *based on public data* it appears more likely *Riot's punishment was correct than not*.

We can't definitively prove intent in a feeder, either, but our reports are still valuable in bringing them to justice, and our amateur analysis of feeders is often as accurate as Riot's. 

I once had a blatantly boosted player in my game (Diamond 5 solo with like 70% win rate, silver 4 flex with about 48% win rate, played like flagrant hot garbage in my silver/gold elo norm game), I reported them via support ticket and the account went inactive almost immediately. I  suppose it's possible that they were banned independent of my report, hard to say.

My point is, unless we're 100% confident that Riot exclusively bans boosted accounts in waves and won't miss any boosted players in such waves, we should still be reporting them if we have adequate reason to do so.

Edit: And unless your standard of proof is unreasonably high, I would certainly say that many such forum smitings are "definitive". If a so-so player suddenly swaps flash keys and champs and goes 27/2/12 nineteen games in a row and goes up six divisions before swapping back and dipping again, there's really no other realistic explanation than boosting.

The standard of proof is evidence that the account was played on by two different humans. There is no public data that can confirm that. As such, there is no public data that would meet mine (or Riot’s) standard of proof.

There is evidence to suggest. *Rarely*, but not commonly at all, this evidence can be “beyond a reasonable doubt”, but that is not the same as *confirmed*, and it being beyond a reasonable doubt does not mean that the data may confirm it is one person.
I don't see why we need to be lawyers about it.
You'd rather aproach the topic as an angry mob?

No, but we shouldn't hamstring ourselves by denying our own capacity to interpret a match history to find evidence of misdeeds.

I can't think of any forum regulars narcissistic enough to think that they're able to provide objective truth over a matter simply by glancing at a match history. We're not gods. But when signals are clear, it's detrimental to suggest that we're not fit to read them. If somebody dies 17 times under the enemy mid turret in 15 minutes, they're an intentional feeder, despite our inability to read their mind. If somebody is a Silver 1 Nasus OTP D-flasher and suddenly climbs to Plat 1 playing Ezreal and Twitch as an F-flasher with an 88% win rate, they're boosted, and I don't need to see the paypall transaction receipt to say it.
